questions.question: What is the primary responsibility of a Team Lead?
options: Guiding the team to deliver high-quality software on time
questions.correctAnswer: Guiding the team to deliver high-quality software on time

questions.question: Which of these is a key soft skill for a Team Lead?
questions.correctAnswer: Empathy

questions.question: How often should you hold one-on-one meetings with team members?
options: Only when they are in trouble
questions.correctAnswer: Regularly (e.g., weekly or bi-weekly)

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Code Review?
options: To find faults and blame developers
To ensure code quality, share knowledge, and find bugs
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure code quality, share knowledge, and find bugs

questions.question: What is 'Servant Leadership'?
options: The leader serves the team by removing blockers and supporting them
The leader acts like a servant
questions.correctAnswer: The leader serves the team by removing blockers and supporting them

questions.question: What is a 'Daily Stand-up'?
options: A 15-minute meeting to sync on progress and blockers
A meeting where everyone stands up
questions.correctAnswer: A 15-minute meeting to sync on progress and blockers

questions.question: How should a Team Lead handle a conflict between two developers?
options: Listen to both sides and facilitate a constructive resolution
questions.correctAnswer: Listen to both sides and facilitate a constructive resolution

questions.question: What is 'Psychological Safety'?
options: A belief that you won't be punished for making a mistake
questions.correctAnswer: A belief that you won't be punished for making a mistake

questions.question: What is the goal of a Retrospective?
options: To discuss what went well, what went wrong, and how to improve
questions.correctAnswer: To discuss what went well, what went wrong, and how to improve

questions.question: What is 'Delegation'?
options: Assigning responsibility for a task to another person
questions.correctAnswer: Assigning responsibility for a task to another person

questions.question: What is the 'Bus Factor'?
options: The risk to a project if key team members are hit by a bus (leave)
questions.correctAnswer: The risk to a project if key team members are hit by a bus (leave)

questions.question: How do you handle a low-performing team member?
options: Provide clear feedback, support, and a performance improvement plan
questions.correctAnswer: Provide clear feedback, support, and a performance improvement plan

questions.question: What is a 'Post-Mortem'?
options: A meeting after an incident to analyze root cause and prevent recurrence
questions.correctAnswer: A meeting after an incident to analyze root cause and prevent recurrence

questions.question: What is 'Technical Debt' management?
options: Balancing new feature development with refactoring and paying down debt
questions.correctAnswer: Balancing new feature development with refactoring and paying down debt

questions.question: What is 'Micromanagement'?
options: Excessive control and monitoring of subordinates
questions.correctAnswer: Excessive control and monitoring of subordinates

questions.question: How to motivate a team?
questions.correctAnswer: Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose

questions.question: What is the 'Stages of Team Development' (Tuckman)?
questions.correctAnswer: Forming, Storming, Norming, Performing

questions.question: What is 'Stakeholder Management'?
options: Managing expectations and communication with those interested in the project
questions.correctAnswer: Managing expectations and communication with those interested in the project

questions.question: How to estimate tasks effectively?
options: Using Story Points or T-shirt sizing with the team
questions.correctAnswer: Using Story Points or T-shirt sizing with the team

questions.question: What is 'Onboarding'?
options: The process of integrating a new employee into the organization
questions.correctAnswer: The process of integrating a new employee into the organization

questions.question: What is 'Scope Creep'?
options: Uncontrolled changes or continuous growth in a project's scope
questions.correctAnswer: Uncontrolled changes or continuous growth in a project's scope

questions.question: What is the role of a 'Tech Lead' vs 'Team Lead'?
options: Tech Lead focuses on technical direction, Team Lead focuses on people/process (though overlaps exist)
questions.correctAnswer: Tech Lead focuses on technical direction, Team Lead focuses on people/process (though overlaps exist)

questions.question: What is 'Pair Programming' benefits?
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge sharing and fewer defects

questions.question: How to handle 'Burnout' in a team?
options: Encourage time off, check workload, and redistribute tasks
questions.correctAnswer: Encourage time off, check workload, and redistribute tasks

questions.question: What is 'KPI'?
questions.correctAnswer: Key Performance Indicator

questions.question: What is 'Situational Leadership'?
options: Adapting leadership style to the task and maturity of the individual
questions.correctAnswer: Adapting leadership style to the task and maturity of the individual

questions.question: How do you calculate 'Velocity'?
options: Sum of story points completed in a sprint
questions.correctAnswer: Sum of story points completed in a sprint

questions.question: What is the 'Eisenhower Matrix'?
options: A tool for prioritizing tasks by urgency and importance
questions.correctAnswer: A tool for prioritizing tasks by urgency and importance

questions.question: What is 'Radical Candor'?
questions.correctAnswer: Caring personally while challenging directly

questions.question: What is 'Brooks's Law'?
options: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later
questions.correctAnswer: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later

questions.question: What is 'Imposter Syndrome'?
options: Doubting your abilities and feeling like a fraud
questions.correctAnswer: Doubting your abilities and feeling like a fraud

questions.question: What is 'OKR'?
questions.correctAnswer: Objectives and Key Results

questions.question: What is 'Conway's Law'?
options: Organizations design systems that mirror their own communication structure
questions.correctAnswer: Organizations design systems that mirror their own communication structure

questions.question: What is 'SPOF'?
questions.correctAnswer: Single Point of Failure

questions.question: What is 'Root Cause Analysis' technique?
questions.correctAnswer: 5 Whys

questions.question: What is 'Leading vs Lagging Indicators'?
options: Leading predicts future, Lagging confirms past
questions.correctAnswer: Leading predicts future, Lagging confirms past

questions.question: What is 'Peter Principle'?
options: People are promoted to their level of incompetence
questions.correctAnswer: People are promoted to their level of incompetence

questions.question: What is 'Groupthink'?
options: The practice of making decisions as a group in a way that discourages creativity or individual responsibility
questions.correctAnswer: The practice of making decisions as a group in a way that discourages creativity or individual responsibility

questions.question: What is 'Pareto Principle' (80/20 Rule)?
options: 80% of effects come from 20% of causes
questions.correctAnswer: 80% of effects come from 20% of causes

questions.question: What is 'Manage Up'?
options: Developing a good working relationship with your manager and stakeholders
questions.correctAnswer: Developing a good working relationship with your manager and stakeholders
